definition: a drop/to drip
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
a drip/a little bit/intravenous drip (used to administer drugs)
bit by bit/dribs and drabs/the little details/every aspect
bit by bit/dribs and drabs/the little details/every aspect
water drop/dripping water
bit by bit/every little bit
drop
to put sb on an intravenous drip
lit. not one drop of water can leak out/watertight/rigorous (argument)
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
raindrop
drip irrigation/to irrigate by drip feed
DiDi, app-based transportation company (abbr. for 滴滴出行[Di1 di1 Chu1 xing2])
DiDi, app-based transportation company (abbr. for 滴滴出行[Di1 di1 Chu1 xing2])
sweet/cute/delicately pretty
sweet/cute/delicately pretty

sentences.english: However, soon after that, she has a relapse of breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: 但是不久，滴發現她的乳癌居然復發。

sentences.english: Take apart the pieces before putting the toys away.
sentences.chinese: 玩具拿開前先將它拆成一件件滴。

sentences.english: Put it where we can see it.
sentences.chinese: 把它放在偶們能看見滴處所。

sentences.english: This is the final chance for 38-year-old Shizuku to have a baby.
sentences.chinese: 對38歲的滴來說，這是她生孩子的機會。

sentences.english: A few drops of a detection liquid are placed on a pad that has been dipped into a drink.
sentences.chinese: 滴幾滴這種測試液在浸過飲品的小墊上。

sentences.english: I heard the sweat from my face hit the wooden floors.
sentences.chinese: 汗珠從我的臉上滑落下來，滴在了木地板上。

sentences.english: You can also add 10 drops of colloidal silver as a natural preservative.
sentences.chinese: 你可以加入10滴液態膠粒銀作爲天然的防腐劑。

sentences.english: Iago distilled poison into Othello's mind.
sentences.chinese: 依阿高把毒藥滴在奧賽羅心中。

sentences.english: Some drop in the water bath also.
sentences.chinese: 還可在水中滴一些浴液。

sentences.english: Princess first took over the boy's tissue, is the onion guy.
sentences.chinese: 健忘公主第一次接過男生滴紙巾，就是蔥頭的。

sentences.english: Cang Li Man's drooling all over the keyboard when looking at the picture.
sentences.chinese: 倉裏滿看着那張圖片，口水噠噠滴，全流在鍵盤上。

sentences.english: The special anti water drop design guarantees no condensed water on the top of the steam box.
sentences.chinese: 特殊的防水滴設計，保證蒸箱頂部絕不產生冷凝水滴。

sentences.english: I dripped a few eye drops into my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我往眼睛裏滴了幾滴眼藥水。

sentences.english: The mist in the background is a cloud of laser-illuminated olive oil droplets. More Photos »
sentences.chinese: 背景中的薄霧爲激光照亮的橄欖油滴形成的雲狀物。

sentences.english: In one word, it has had the fundamental influence on the essence of Yan Yu poetics in spirit.
sentences.chinese: 這對嚴羽詩學滴精神實質產生了根本影響。

sentences.english: If the level is correct, fluid should just trickle, or drip out of, the centre of the drain plug.
sentences.chinese: 如果油量正確，你只會見到波箱油慢慢滴或者流出黎。

definition: a drop
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)

abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
battle cry
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
(phonetic)/command to a horse/clatter (of horses' hoofs)
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)

to cough up/also pr. [ka3]
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to scatter/to sprinkle/to spill
Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
modal particle expressing exclamation
see 咧咧[lie1 lie1]
to draw back the corners of one's mouth
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
saliva
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
dialectal equivalent of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
gnaw
loud noise/shout/suddenly

Oh! (interjection indicating slight surprise)
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
